columns.name: task_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task.

columns.name: container_instance_arn
columns.description: The ARN of the container instances that host the task.

columns.name: cluster_name
columns.description: A user-generated string that you use to identify your cluster.

columns.name: desired_status
columns.description: The desired status of the task.

columns.name: launch_type
columns.description: The infrastructure on which your task is running.

columns.name: availability_zone
columns.description: The availability zone of the task.

columns.name: capacity_provider_name
columns.description: The capacity provider associated with the task.

columns.name: cluster_arn
columns.description: The ARN of the cluster that hosts the task.

columns.name: connectivity
columns.description: The connectivity status of a task.

columns.name: connectivity_at
columns.description: The Unix timestamp for when the task last went into CONNECTED status.

columns.name: cpu
columns.description: The number of CPU units used by the task as expressed in a task definition.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: The Unix timestamp for when the task was created.

columns.name: enable_execute_command
columns.description: Whether or not execute command functionality is enabled for this task. If true, this enables execute command functionality on all containers in the task.

columns.name: execution_stopped_at
columns.description: The Unix timestamp for when the task execution stopped.

columns.name: group
columns.description: The name of the task group associated with the task.

columns.name: health_status
columns.description: The health status for the task, which is determined by the health of the essential containers in the task. If all essential containers in the task are reporting as HEALTHY, then the task status also reports as HEALTHY.

columns.name: last_status
columns.description: The last known status of the task.

columns.name: memory
columns.description: The amount of memory (in MiB) used by the task as expressed in a task definition.

columns.name: platform_version
columns.description: The platform version on which your task is running.

columns.name: pull_started_at
columns.description: The Unix timestamp for when the container image pull began.

columns.name: pull_stopped_at
columns.description: The Unix timestamp for when the container image pull completed.

columns.name: service_name
columns.description: The name of the service.

columns.name: started_at
columns.description: The Unix timestamp for when the task started.

columns.name: started_by
columns.description: The tag specified when a task is started.

columns.name: stop_code
columns.description: The stop code indicating why a task was stopped.

columns.name: stopped_at
columns.description: The Unix timestamp for when the task was stopped.

columns.name: stopped_reason
columns.description: The reason that the task was stopped.

columns.name: stopping_at
columns.description: The Unix timestamp for when the task stops.

columns.name: task_definition_arn
columns.description: The ARN of the task definition that creates the task.

columns.name: version
columns.description: The version counter for the task.

columns.name: attachments
columns.description: The Elastic Network Adapter associated with the task if the task uses the awsvpc network mode.

columns.name: attributes
columns.description: The attributes of the task.

columns.name: containers
columns.description: The containers associated with the task.

columns.name: ephemeral_storage
columns.description: The ephemeral storage settings for the task.

columns.name: inference_accelerators
columns.description: The Elastic Inference accelerator associated with the task.

columns.name: overrides
columns.description: One or more container overrides.

columns.name: protection
columns.description: Protection status of task in an Amazon ECS service.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags associated with task.
